results.title: Philadelphia with love
results.creator_credit: James A. Love, Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania and Nassau Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the modern city of Philadelphia, a beneficiary of urban renewal, a city where sports and cultural opportunities are readily available. Describes the parks, museums, institutions of higher learning, the city government and the office of the mayor. “Philadelphia with love” sung by Sergio Franchi. Narration by Joel Craeger.

results.title: Pets and people: The story of Uncle Ben's in Australia
results.creator_credit: John Kenyon and Sapphire Films Melbourne
results.brief_description: Don’t let the titles fool you - this thinly disguised documentary has little to do with people and their pets. Rather it is a piece of shameless promotion of Uncle Ben’s pet food. At times the film also looks at Albury - Wodonga - however one comes to realise that such a focus is looked at only in terms of Uncle Ben’s community involvement. Once you locate the essence of the film, what you see that is really about is a decentralised industry, quality control and general propaganda.
results.title_for_label: Pets and people: The story of Uncle Ben’s in Australia

results.title: Peripheral Produce: all time greatest hits
results.brief_description: Peripheral Produce defines itself as a “as a propaganda machine that promotes underground cinematic endeavours.” It began as a monthly screening series of independent and experimental short film and video works in Portland, Oregon in 1996 and soon after set up a distribution arm to disseminate these works. This, their tenth release is a “best of” collection of works made between 1998 and 2002. “Getting stronger every day” explores the imaginative life of children in mundanely poignant tableaux where the spirit realm manifests in lo-tech effects and remembered TV movies. “Wustenspringmaus” is a quirky documentary about wily rodent of the title, also known as the gerbil. “The Subconscious art of graffiti removal” is a keen observation about visual aesthetics of graffiti removal that reveals how the destruction of one art form unwittingly creates another. “Stuffing” is a found footage video juxtaposing images to create humorous and absurd associations. In “Removed” an old pornographic film is manipulated using nail polish and bleach, to erase the image of the woman from the scene. “Election collectables” is a faux-recreation of a home shopping network where presidential candidates spruik collectables commemorating the 2000 elections. “N Judah 5:30” captures fleeting images of tired commuters. “Oona’s veil” is a study in celluloid decomposition using a strip of film from a screen test. “Crowdog” is a personal documentary in which the filmmaker recalls events that took place during the years in her teens when she stopped wearing shoes. “Buffalo Common” documents the dismantling of the ballistic missile industry in North Dakota - leaving the state to reconsider its already pessimistic future.

results.title: Electronics in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Through simple diagrams and explanations this film illustrates the role of valves, transistors, IC’s, oscillators, filters, amplifiers and microprocessors in basic electronics and discusses their application in computers, electrical appliances, sound recording and medical diagnosis.

results.title: Perfumes of France
results.brief_description: The famous perfume of France, from flower to bottle. The cultivation of flower around Grasse in the south of France and the extraction of the essential oils; blending and testing of new perfumes; bottling and marketing the great perfumes.

results.title: People over the Plenty
results.brief_description: The film follows the reconstruction of the Greensborough footbridge after the original cable suspension bridge was swept away in the River Plenty floods of 1974. The Shire of Diamond Valley contracted B.C.S. Consulting Engineers and Surveyors and Gibbs Bright & Co, timber suppliers to rebuild the bridge. The Greensborough Bridge is unique in that it is the first structure of its kind to be made of pine, is the longest footbridge in Australia and was aesthetically designed to blend in perfect harmony with its rural surroundings.

results.title: People in Peking
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The New China No. 1”.
Shows scenes in Peking, living conditions and daily life of industrial workers and their families, modern buildings, public parks and palaces maintained as showplaces, and National Day celebrations including callisthenic displays, human mosaic exhibitions and fireworks
